file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 34-43-01-04 - TCAS PROCESSOR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TCAS PROCESSOR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the TCAS ll or TCAS 2000 processor, as applicable. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 34-43-01-000-801-A TCAS PROCESSOR - REMOVAL ALL 34-43-01-400-801-A TCAS PROCESSOR - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 34-43-01 Page 1 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 34-43-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. TCAS PROCESSOR - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the TCAS II or TCAS 2000 Processor, as applicable. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-04/100 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 232 Passenger cabin, RH side D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task In the passenger cabin I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the TCAS circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to it. (2) Get access to the TCAS Processor (AMM MPP 06-41-04/100). J. Removal (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Release the knurled nuts (2) which attach the TCAS Processor (1). (2) Pull the TCAS Processor (1) by its handle, until it is disconnected from the connector (3) installed on the mounting rack. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 34-43-01 Page 2 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Remove the TCAS Processor (1) from the mounting rack. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 34-43-01 Page 3 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH TCAS II PROCESSOR TCAS II Processor - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONE 232 DET. A B 1. TCAS II PROCESSOR 2. KNURLED NUT (2) DET. B 3. CONNECTOR (2) 145AMM340166.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 34-43-01 Page 4 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH TCAS 2000 PROCESSOR TCAS 2000 Processor - Removal/Installation Figure 402 A ZONE 232 DET. A 1. TCAS 2000 PROCESSOR B 2. KNURLED NUT (2) DET. B 3. CONNECTOR (2) 145AMM340248.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 34-43-01 Page 5 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 34-43-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. TCAS PROCESSOR - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the TCAS II or TCAS 2000 Processor, as applicable. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-04/100 - AMM TASK 34-43-00-700-801-A/500 TCAS - OPERATIONAL TEST S.B.145-34-0106 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 232 Passenger cabin, RH side D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task In the passenger cabin I. Installation (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) If the TCAS Processor is installed due to a connector replacement and the aircraft has complied with S.B.145-34-0106, then make sure that electrical connections are according to S.B. 145-34-0106. (2) Install the TCAS Processor (1) on the mounting rack. (3) Push the TCAS Processor (1) by its handle until it is connected to the connector (3) installed on the mounting rack. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 34-43-01 Page 6 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (4) Tighten the knurled nuts (2) which attach the TCAS Processor (1) to the mounting rack. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, close the TCAS circuit breaker and remove the DO-NOT- CLOSE tag from it. (2) Do the TCAS operational test ( AMM TASK 34-43-00-700-801-A/500). (3) Close the access to the TCAS Processor (AMM MPP 06-41-04/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 34-43-01 Page 7 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
